Welcome to Application of the tower of hanoi in psychology’s documentation!¶

DSA Summative: Test for cognitive recognition using a tower of hanoi puzzle game¶

core.blit_text(screen, text, midtop, aa=True, font=None, font_name=None, size=None, color=(255, 0, 0))[source]¶
Parameters

screen – Screen intended for gameplay and interactivity with the user

:type screen:blit (block transfer) :param text: text if any implemented in the app :type text: Any :param midtop: integer value used for measurements in the program :type midtop: Any :param aa: boolean parameter to use in the app :type aa: bool = True :param font: Font of the game if any :type font: Optional[{render}] = None :param font_name: Font name or family of the game if any :type font_name: Any = None :param size: size appropriate for the app :type size: Any = None :param color: colors used in the app :type color: Tuple[int, int, int] = (255, 0, 0)) -> None

core.check_won()[source]¶

Method to check if the user has won the game

core.draw_disks()[source]¶

Method to draw the disks :return: Display the drawn disks on the screen :rtype: none

core.draw_ptr()[source]¶

Method to show interactivity of the discs to the user :return: Shows the cursor which is used to move the disks :rtype: none

core.draw_towers()[source]¶

Method to draw the towers or rods used for the game

core.game_over()[source]¶

Method to end the game after the game is terminated to show cognitive ability of the user with the corresponding results

core.make_disks()[source]¶

Method to create the disks

core.menu_screen()[source]¶

Method to be called before starting actual game loop This is the initial menu of the screen

core.reset()[source]¶

Method to reset the game
